author: @wizcase
title: OpenAI Introduces Study Mode For ChatGPT
text:
OpenAI launched a new feature called Study Mode on ChatGPT on Tuesday. The tool is designed to help students engage in conversations that promote learning and deeper understanding. Study Mode has begun rolling out to users on the Free, Plus, Pro, and Team plans, and will soon be available on ChatGPT Edu.
In a rush? Here are the quick facts:
OpenAI launched Study Mode for ChatGPT Users will be able to engage in interactive conversations that promote learning and deeper understanding. Study Mode has begun rolling out to users on the Free, Plus, Pro, and Team plans, and will soon be available on ChatGPT Edu. According to the official announcement , ChatGPT has become one of the main tools for learning across the world. However, concerns remain about whether or not students are truly understanding and processing the information they receive. Study mode aims to provide an interactive learning experience rather than simply delivering answers.
‚ÄúInstead of doing the work for them, study mode encourages students to think critically about their learning,‚Äù said Robbie Torney, Senior Director of AI Programs at Common Sense Media. ‚ÄúFeatures like these are a positive step toward effective AI use for learning. Even in the AI era, the best learning still happens when students are excited about and actively engaging with the lesson material.‚Äù
As ChatGPT becomes a go-to tool for students, we‚Äôre committed to ensuring it fosters deeper understanding and learning.
Introducing study mode in ChatGPT ‚Äî a learning experience that helps you work through problems step-by-step instead of just getting an answer. pic.twitter.com/B8VbRYJH6r
‚Äî OpenAI (@OpenAI) July 29, 2025
OpenAI said it has been working with pedagogy experts, teachers and scientists to develop the tool, with a particular focus on college students.
Among its main features, OpenAI highlighted Socratic questioning‚Äîa methodology also used by Anthropic in its ‚ÄòClaude for Education‚Äô program‚Äîwhich guides students toward active learning. Other features include personalized support tailored to the student‚Äôs level, knowledge quizzes, and progress tracking.
OpenAI showed in short videos how study mode operates, like teaching a student about Game Theory and designing a learning guide, or helping another user with a homework on algorithms.
The company clarified that the feature has limitations and that they expect to gain more feedback to improve the learning tool.
OpenAI is also working on an AI education project in the United States , align with Microsoft and Anthropic, to support educators across with AI training, and building a facility in New York.

author: Hannah Knudsen
title: Karl Rove Endorses Doug Burgum for Vice President
text:
Karl Rove endorsed North Dakota Gov. Doug Burgum for former President Donald Trump‚Äôs running mate, making the remark on Thursday, days ahead of the Republican National Convention taking place in Milwaukee, Wisconsin.
Trump has yet to officially announce his choice for vice president and is expected to make that announcement any day now. However, there has been chatter with a few names continually surfacing, including Ohio Sen. J.D. Vance and Burgum. As for Karl Rove, he believes Burgum is the correct choice.
Of the three names mentioned, ‚ÄúDoug Burgum is not only the safe pick, but also gives him some advantage in that he‚Äôs got a successful governor, who‚Äôs the governor of the second-largest energy producing state in the union,‚Äù Rove explained.
‚ÄúIf you want to make energy an issue in the campaign, who better than that? But I‚Äôm with Josh. I think we‚Äôre ‚Äî we got to think about Donald Trump as not just simply the former president and potentially future president the United States, but the executive producer of The Apprentice ,‚Äù he said, explaining there ‚Äúmay be a couple of twists and turns before this thing is all done.‚Äù
His remarks come as all eyes largely move to Sen. Vance, particularly following the news that Donald Trump Jr. is slated to speak right before Trump‚Äôs running mate at the convention on Wednesday. It is widely known that Don Jr. is friends with Vance and has openly stated that the senator is his top choice for his father‚Äôs running mate.
‚ÄúIf we‚Äôre talking the VP stakes, what are you guys thinking right now?‚Äù Don Jr. asked during a recent episode of his podcast, Triggered . ‚ÄúYou know, everyone knows, I‚Äôve sort of been for J.D. Vance.‚Äù
He also shared a clip of Vance speaking recently, encouraging people to watch it.
‚ÄúStop what you‚Äôre doing and watch this right now if you want to know what America First is all about,‚Äù he remarked:
Stop what you're doing and watch this right now if you want to know what America First is all aboutüî•
‚ÄúAmerica is not just an idea. America is a nation. America is a group of people with a common history and a common future.‚Äù ‚Äì @JDVance1 pic.twitter.com/1zQEv9u1Mm
‚Äî Donald Trump Jr. (@DonaldJTrumpJr) July 11, 2024
Notably, last month, Burgum made it clear that he believes Trump can win ‚Äúregardless of who is vice president.‚Äù
‚ÄúI think if we actually look in political history, the last time a vice-president pick actually helped swing an election was when Kennedy picked Lyndon Johnson and Lyndon Johnson help Kennedy win that race,‚Äù he said.
‚ÄúAnd with President Trump, right now, where he is with Hispanics, with blacks, with people under age 30 and with independents. I mean, he‚Äôs very strong across the board. So he can pick someone that you can focus on like, ‚ÄòHey, let‚Äôs, let‚Äôs get someone gets stuff done.‚Äô Let‚Äôs get someone who helps him govern,‚Äù he added.
2024 Election Politics Donald Trump Donald Trump Jr. Doug Burgum J.D. Vance Karl Rove Vice President

author: KALB Digital Team
title: NPSO arrests sex offender for failing to register and gun charges
text:
NATCHITOCHES PARISH, La. (KALB) - A registered sex offender who failed to comply with Louisiana‚Äôs sex offender registration laws has been arrested, according to the Natchitoches Parish Sheriff‚Äôs Office.
NPSO said Eduardo Garibay had maintained his registration in Texas, but did not fulfill his legal obligation to register in Louisiana after living in Natchitoches Parish for over a year.
Eduardo Garibay (Natchitoches Parish Sheriff's Office) NPSO obtained an arrest warrant for Garibay for one count of failure to register as a sex offender under Louisiana law.
A search warrant was executed at his residence as well. Authorities found two firearms, one of which was a .357 Magnum Smith and Wesson Revolver, found to have been reported as stolen by the Desoto Parish Sheriff‚Äôs Office. The second firearm, a .22 caliber Savage Rifle, was reported as lost through a Texas law enforcement agency.
As a convicted felon, Garibay is prohibited from possessing firearms.
On April 7, Garibay was arrested and booked into the LaSalle Corrections for one count of failure to register as a sex offender, two counts of possession of a firearm by a person convicted of certain felonies and one count of illegal possession of a stolen firearm.
The Natchitoches Parish Sheriff‚Äôs Office urges the public to report any information about non-compliant sex offenders. Tips can be submitted anonymously on the NPSO website at npsheriff.org . Information regarding registered sex offenders in the area can also be accessed via the website or by calling the NPSO Criminal Investigations Bureau at 318-357-7830.

author: Reuters
title: Supreme Court's Clarence Thomas took additional trips paid for by benefactor, senator says By Reuters
text:
By John Kruzel
WASHINGTON (Reuters) -U.S. Supreme Court Justice Clarence Thomas took at least three additional trips funded by billionaire benefactor Harlan Crow that the conservative justice failed to disclose, the Democratic chair of the Senate Judiciary Committee said on Thursday.
Crow, a Texas businessman and Republican donor, disclosed details about the justice's travel between 2017 and 2021 in response to a Judiciary Committee vote last November to authorize subpoenas to Crow and Leonard Leo, another influential conservative figure, according to Senator Dick Durbin.
Thomas has previously come under criticism for failing to disclose gifts from Crow. Thomas on June 7 revised his 2019 financial disclosure form to acknowledge that Crow paid for his "food and lodging" at a Bali hotel and at a California club.
But the filing by Thomas failed to disclose that Crow had paid for his travel by private jet related to the Bali and California trips, and an eight-day excursion on a yacht in Indonesia - omissions revealed on Thursday in a redacted document that Durbin's office said contained travel itineraries for which Crow had provided the justice with transportation.
The document shows private jet travel in May 2017 between St. Louis, Montana and Dallas; private jet travel in March 2019 between Washington and Savannah, Georgia; and private jet travel in June 2021 between Washington and San Jose, California.
Crow reached an agreement to provide information requested by the committee dating back seven years, Crow spokesperson Michael Zona said. As a condition of this, the committee agreed to end its probe into Crow, Zona added.
"Despite his serious and continued concerns about the legality and necessity of the inquiry, Mr. Crow engaged in good faith negotiations with the committee from the beginning to resolve the matter," Zona said.
A Supreme Court spokesperson did not immediately respond to a request for comment.
"The Senate Judiciary Committee's ongoing investigation into the Supreme Court's ethical crisis is producing new information - like what we've revealed (Thursday) - and makes it crystal clear that the highest court needs an enforceable code of conduct, because its members continue to choose not to meet the moment," Durbin said.
Under pressure from criticism over ethics, the Supreme Court last November adopted its first code of conduct.
Critics and some congressional Democrats have said the code does not go far enough to promote transparency, continuing to leave decisions to recuse from cases to the justices themselves and providing no mechanism of enforcement.
Supreme Court's Clarence Thomas took additional trips paid for by benefactor, senator says

author: NewsBreak Original
title: The warmest December in Giles County history
text: The popular image of an idyllic December is one of white Christmases, hot chocolate retreats, snow-capped conifers, and cozy, cold-weather activities. But not every December lives up to those expectations. Most of the continental U.S. will experience its peak winter cold weather in January and February . Officially, winter doesn't even start until Dec. 21. Across the U.S., the average December temperature from 1901-2000 was right above freezing point, at 32.68 F. Yearly temperatures can be compared to this 20th-century long-term average to find how uncommon a year's December climate was. The nation's warmest December on record was 2021, when the average temperature reached 6.66 F above the long-term average, at 39.34 F. December 2022 was closer to the previous century's average for the U.S. overall, at 33.08 F. The average temperature in Giles County, Virginia from 1901-2000 was 33.7. The diverse climates of the U.S. mean residents can experience a range of holiday weather without breaking out their passports. Within the continental U.S., Monroe County, Florida, at the Southeast tip of the state, reported the highest average December temperature during the past century at 67.6 F. On the other end of the spectrum was Roseau County, Minnesota, bordering Canada, at 7.2 F. However, across both sides of the extremes, temperatures are warming. While that doesn't mean every December will be warmer than the last or the prior century's average, it does mean long-term temperature averages will continue to inch up the thermometer. When did Giles County, Virginia experience its warmest December? To find out, Stacker used data from the National Centers for Environmental Information to identify the 15 Decembers with the highest average temperature since 1895. Also included is how that year's temperature compared to the 1901-2000 average. Read on to see if you lived through the warmest December in Giles County, Virginia history.

author: Israel Bulus
title: UK-funded programme partners Kaduna schools on learning skills
text: A UK-funded educational programme, the Partnership for Learning for All in Nigeria, has called for immediate government action to improve the poor learning outcomes of primary school pupils in Kaduna State.

author: Alyssa Gallardo
title: Enjoy a summer full of 'wow' at Edmonton's Telus World of Science
text:
Get ready to blast off into an incredible world of wonder!
Whether it‚Äôs one of their laser shows, a Friday trivia night, or an adults-only evening away from kids, Telus World of Science is the spot to check out.
Not to mention, this summer is the best time to see what Telus World of Science has to offer!
Until Sept. 30, guests can save 20 per cent on Science Centre General Admission and IMAX tickets when purchasing tickets online in advance.
What to expect Currently, it is running its Stardust: The Universe in You feature exhibition, which invites guests to explore the stars and cosmos.
This hands-on scientific adventure guides guests through the Big Bang and the beginning of the universe, through the birth of stars, and into interactive displays where you can create your own galaxy.
In addition to its regular featured exhibitions, Telus World of Science hosts a variety of events.
If you find yourself with a Friday night free, check out its Friday Trivia Nights .
With free entry, this family-friendly evening event promises nightly prizes and exclusive giveaways to participants in six rounds of tremendous trivia fun. There will be questions covering everything from music, movies, and sports to nature, geography, and, last but not least, science.
Looking for something a bit more flashy?
Telus World of Science is running its themed laser shows all summer long. Under the cover of the Zeidler Dome, guests can experience a dazzling array of laser projections set to popular artists.
Check out laser Taylor Swift, laser The Weeknd, or its new addition, laser ABBA.
For those science-inclined adults who aren‚Äôt a fan of the kid part of the family-friendly atmosphere, don‚Äôt worry.
Sip and Science: Cosmos is Telus World of Science‚Äôs latest adult-only event. On Aug. 8, adults are invited to sip cocktails and explore the star-powered spaces at their own pace.
Tickets to this event include full access to the featured exhibition, the hands-on Health Zone gallery, and a special screening of The Sky Tonight in the Zeidler Dome.
It doesn‚Äôt matter whether it‚Äôs with family, friends, or just an informative date out for yourself; Telus World of Science is definitely worth checking out this summer.
Telus World of Science ‚Äî Edmonton Where: 11211 142nd St. NW, Edmonton, Alta.
Cost: Varies

author: Jack Baer, Yahoo Sports
title: No. 9 Missouri finds enough life to beat No. 7 Ohio State in Cotton Bowl slog ‚Äì 95.5 WSB
text: No. 9 Missouri's surprising season ended with a 14-3 win over a declawed No. 7 Ohio State in the Cotton Bowl Classic on Friday, setting up the program for its first top 10 finish since 2013. To say the game was a slog would be generous. Only one drive in the first half ended in something other than a punt, when Ohio State turned some generous field position into a 44-yard field goal. The two teams combined for 183 yards total, averaging 2.8 yards per play. Ohio State entered the game shorthanded on offense, missing starting quarterback Kyle McCord and Heisman Trophy finalist Marvin Harrison Jr., then lost back-up quarterback Devin Brown to an injury in the first quarter. Third-stringer Lincoln Kienholz, who had attempted five passes total this season entering bowl season, took over. It was almost jarring when Missouri broke the ice at the end of the third quarter. Quarterback Brady Cook hit a wide-open Marquis Johnson on play action for 50 yards to go from deep in the Tigers' territory to the red zone. Before that, Missouri's longest play had been for 17 yards, It was only the second time the Ohio State defense allowed a play of 40+ yards all season and set up what wound up being the decisive score. The Buckeyes responded with one of their best drives of the game, but a Kienholz fumble ended it at the Mizzou 35. The Tigers responded with a 13-play, 91-yard drive to put the game away.

author: Redacci√≥n de La Nueva.
title: Hugo Modearelli: ‚ÄúLa gente de Bah√≠a y sus trabajadores se mostraron solidarios‚Äù
text: Hugo Modarelli: ‚ÄúLa gente de Bah√≠a y sus trabajadores se mostraron solidarios‚Äù El secretario general de ATSA, filial Bah√≠a Blanca, resalt√≥ el compromiso de todos los sectores y de los profesionales de la salud. ‚ÄúSe fue otro a√±o donde todos los trabajadores de la Sanidad volvieron a mostrarse solidarios ante la adversidad. Nuestra ciudad, recientemente, pas√≥ por un momento muy duro por razones clim√°ticas y un temporal que arras√≥ con todo lo que ten√≠a enfrente. Se perdieron vidas, algo que se lamentar√° eternamente, y tambi√©n se contabilizaron da√±os materiales dif√≠ciles de afrontar. Ante todo ese panorama los Hospitales y las cl√≠nicas respondieron con el ya reconocido esmero de todos sus profesionales". El mensaje de Hugo Modarelli, secretario general de la Asociaci√≥n de Trabajadores de la Sanidad Argentina, va m√°s all√° de los afiliados al gremio e involucra a todos los ciudadanos de Bah√≠a Blanca y los distritos lindantes. "El esfuerzo fue de todos. Gente com√∫n solidariz√°ndose con el vecino y colaborando con lo que ten√≠an a su alcance; como tambi√©n aquellos que aportaron herramientas o trabajo, conocedores de sus oficios, para aliviar la situaci√≥n de personas que se quedaron sin techo o, directamente, sin sus hogares. Tambi√©n result√≥ sumamente valiosa presencia del gobernador Axel Kicillof y el aporte del intendente Federico Susbielles al frente de Defensa Civil en un trabajo a destajo en cada rinc√≥n de la ciudad; y ni hablar de los bomberos, ambulancias y quienes contribuyeron desde otras localidades o ciudades con aportes solidarios o arribando para dar una mano, como sucedi√≥ con la reparaci√≥n del tendido el√©ctrico". Modarelli tambi√©n se refiri√≥ a la solidaridad expuesta por los trabajadores de la salud. "Hubo profesionales como m√©dicos y enfermeros que arriesgaron su vida en el momento m√°s complicado, cuando la tormenta caus√≥ estragos, por el s√≥lo hecho de llegar cuanto antes a su lugar de trabajo y cumplir con el cometido de ayudar a qui√©n lo necesitaba. Para todos ellos, e incluy√≥ a todo el personal de la salud, mis m√°s sincero agradecimiento", dijo. "Cabe resaltar, como lo hago cada vez que expongo como secretario general de ATSA Bah√≠a Blanca, que el gremio est√° a disposici√≥n de quienes necesiten nuestra ayuda", puntualiz√≥ Modarelli. "Por √∫ltimo un mensaje de solidaridad y amor para que este 2024 que ya se inicia nos encuentre mucho m√°s unidos y mejor en todos los aspectos, con trabajo y salud, pero por sobre todas las cosas con una ciudad de pie", concluy√≥ Hugo Modarelli, secretario general de la Asociaci√≥n de Trabajadores de la Sanidad, Bah√≠a Blanca.
